intro: Crepis hyoseroides, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear chickweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has small, hairy leaves with a distinctive rosette shape. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces small, achene fruits that are dispersed by wind. Crepis hyoseroides is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
